body_html:
A comment on why the typed create methods take a DataType parameter, it is to support unsigned values in the future. i.e.:

IntBuffer buffer = ...
Tensor t = Tensor.create(DataType.UINT32, shape, buffer);

Note the JDK 8 support for unsigned values (reference).
body_text:
A comment on why the typed create methods take a DataType parameter, it is to support unsigned values in the future.   i.e.:
IntBuffer buffer = ...
Tensor t = Tensor.create(DataType.UINT32, shape, buffer);
Note the JDK 8 support for unsigned values (reference).
body:
A comment on why the typed `create` methods take a `DataType` parameter, it is to support unsigned values in the future.   i.e.:
```java
IntBuffer buffer = ...
Tensor t = Tensor.create(DataType.UINT32, shape, buffer);
```

Note the JDK 8 support for unsigned values ([reference](https://blogs.oracle.com/darcy/entry/unsigned_api)).
